review: Tortex is great i really like their picks there may be better but these have fit the bill i prefer the yellow ones they are a little thinner
another item never received but i would not use anything over .88 mm anyway was mean for experimentation i have learned since this purchase.
winds your strings its durable and will cut your strings as well  you can pull your pins at the bridge with it as well.
sorry i noticed no difference i believe the price was really good for all the hype they put into these strings
use it on acoustic and electric always lose them before i ever wear them out.  I dont go any lighter than the yellow picks sometimes i use the green which are a little thicker.
Comes unassembled but is a no brainer to connect the 2 pieces to the frame. works well more stable than my 14 dollar stand.
Tunes by sound or vibration thats all i use it for the vibration mode is really nice. buy one its convenient

It was almost obvious this product would come from china but even worse when it ships from china.  Any thing i have bought that was shipped directly from china has been much lower quality than anything retailers are even willing to sell.  If you can wait a month for delivery or longer, if you dont mind your guitar falling off the wall when the chinese quality lives up to its reputation then order up.  If you have over a $500 guitar be wise and buy an expensive one unfortunately they will most likely be made in china too. I have decided to build my own
